intro: Sarcophrynium prionogonium var. puberulifolium, commonly known as the velvet-leafed sarcophrynium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) leaves, which give it its specific epithet "puberulifolium." The flowers are small and clustered, often producing bright yellow or orange petals, making it an attractive ornamental plant.
